content:
I was working on an issue when I noticed that, if a person is deactivated, instead of showing the last active date, we could also show the deactivated status in the tooltip or below the name, giving users more information about a specific recipient user.

King Hamlet is a deactivated user
Screenshot-from-2023-01-24-18-21-37.png
This topic was moved here from #frontend > deactivated user pm-tooltip by Alya Abbott.
Hm, yeah, that seems helpful. Do folks think the "Last active" part should still be there, or should it just say that the user has been deactivated?
I lean towards only saying that the user is deactivated.

Yeah, I think just displaying that they're deactivated is plenty for this context. You should be able to get more information by clicking on the user to visit your PM thread with them, though you might need to hunt for a message they sent to click their user card.
But in this setting, just the fact that they're deactivated seems like plenty of information.
I am currently working on an issue to disable the compose box and modify the narrow banner for deactivated users. I will also add this feature to display deactivated instead of last active .
